title.narrative: Tejaswini: Socioeconomic Empowerment of Adolescent Girls & Young Women

description.narrative: To improve completion of market-driven skills training and secondary education for adolescent girls and young women in select districts of Jharkhand.

participating-org.narrative: Department of Women and Child Development and Social Security

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Audit | Description :JWDS to submit financial statements for each fiscal year, audited by independent auditors,within 9 months after the end of the fiscal year | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Field Guidelines | Description :JWDS to prepare field guidelines, within 3 months after Effectiveness, detailingthe operational procedures and allocation of responsibilities to be followed in all community-based interventions and/or theprovision of non-formal and skills training. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Grievance Redressal/Complaints Processing | Description :GoJ to maintain and operate a grievance redressalmechanism and processing protocol for the handling of any stakeholder complaints arising out of the project activities. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Responsibility | Description :Government of Jharkhand (GoJ) to vest overall responsibility forproject coordination and implementation in the DWCDSS, acting through its JWDS | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Units â€“ I | Description :DWCDSS and/or JWDS to maintain: (i) a Project Steering Committee,chaired by Chief Secretary, GoJ, to provide strategic guidance and policy directives; (ii) a Project Implementation Committee,chaired by the Principal Secretary/Secretary, DWCDSS, GoJ, to supervise/monitor Project implementation and resolve implementationbottlenecks; (iii) a Project Implementation Unit, headed by a Project Director and responsible for day-to-day implementation ofProject activities; and (iv) Inter-departmental District Coordination Committees to coordinate convergence in each select districtand oversee local interventions. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Units â€“ II | Description :Prior to commencing activities in a particular district/block JWDSto: (i) establish and maintain District Resource and Implementation Units in each select district to serve as nodal implementingunit in each such district; and (ii) establish and maintain in each Block of an Intense Pilot District, or cause the NGOs hiredunder service agreements to establish and maintain in each Block of a select district (other than the Intense Pilot Districts),Block Resource and Implementation Units to liaise and assist NGOs, community facilitators and training providers with theimplementation of Project activities. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Internal Audit | Description :JWDS to hire a firm or chartered public accountants, within 6 months afterEffectiveness, to serve as internal auditor and carry out periodic internal audits of JWDSâ€™s accounts as per the FM Manual. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Documents (including safeguards) | Description :GoJ to ensure that JWDS implements the Project inaccordance with the Operations Manual and Implementation Plan, the Field Guidelines, the FM Manual, the Procurement Manual, the EMPand the SITP | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
